channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2nd broken bench, 16th July
item.description:
1 bench OUTSIDE the garden square (the modern benches right opposite the Eliz Line entrance) has a broken metal armrest which needs reattaching. I know this is a very similar report to the one I just made, but it is two separate benches ! Thanks so much WCC you are fantastic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Hanover Square, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken bench, 16th July
item.description:
Broken bench inside garden Enter garden square through west gate opposite Medici Passage/Eliz Line station, and the first bench on the right has a broken/missing armrest (sharp wood, is just broken off, etc).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Hanover Square, Mayfair, City of Westminster

item.title: Donnieâ€™s, Noise, Light, and Odour Disturbance After Closing Hours, 16th July
item.description:
Despite closing at 11 pm, the restaurant continues noisy cleaning, staff voices, ventilation system, bright lighting, and emits strong smells well past midnight. These disturbances regularly affect our sleep and rest

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westgate Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing street bins, 15th July
item.description:
The bins shown in the photos I've included having been spilling out rubbish like this for several weeks. They are situated at the junction of Blanmerle path ( alleyway running adjacent to New Eltham Railway Station, ) and Blanmerle road. It appears that once the council bin was full a domestic bin was added. Please empty them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Blanmerle Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 15th July
item.description:
People in the area leave large-sized rubbish in the alley between 46 and 48 Godstow Road from time to time, every time the place is cleaned up, someone starts to leave rubbish here again

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Godstow Road, Thamesmead, London
